title: Simulations
text: vignette, explore use package simulated data. function four options, ‘simple’, ‘stratify’, ‘sliding’, ‘segment’. follow vignette.

title: Simulations
text: Consider simple data set generated . Suppose interested regression y∼β0+β1x+β2z+β3xzy\sim \beta_0+\beta_1x+\beta_2z+\beta_3xz. can codified follows, noting first value output data.frame estimates. model original data computed. simulation returns value similar definitely different true values can resampled follows. resampling returns better estimates.
code: set.seed(12345) n <- 100  data_simple <- data.frame('y'=rep(NA,n),                           'x'=rnorm(n),                           'z'=rexp(n)) outliers <- runif(3,1,n) data_simple[outliers,'x'] <- 25*data_simple[outliers,'x'] data_simple[outliers,'z'] <- 10*data_simple[outliers,'z'] errors <- rnorm(n,0,5) errors[outliers] <- 10*errors[outliers] data_simple$y <- 1 + 2*data_simple$x - 3*data_simple$z + data_simple$x*data_simple$z + errors simple_function <- function(X){   reg <- lm(y~x*z, data=X)      coef(summary(reg)) } set.seed(12345) simple_function(data_simple) #>              Estimate Std. Error    t value     Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept)  2.219431 0.67733701   3.276700 1.462497e-03 #> x            1.979461 0.54657468   3.621575 4.700884e-04 #> z           -3.889885 0.23856433 -16.305391 2.059537e-29 #> x:z          1.027983 0.02839339  36.205003 9.089283e-58 set.seed(12345) res <- resample_function(data_simple, simple_function) res$estimates #>    estimates        sd  lowerNorm upperNorm lowerResamp upperResamp #> 1  1.4913547 0.9644652 -0.3989623  3.381672  -0.4892050    3.218052 #> 2  1.9859832 0.6215633  0.7677415  3.204225   0.9410143    3.367920 #> 3 -2.9899624 0.8643272 -4.6840127 -1.295912  -4.1167781   -1.414524 #> 4  0.9763641 0.2702915  0.4466026  1.506126   0.1939155    1.241718

title: Simulations
text: Consider stratified data set generated . see major balance groups  Suppose interested following regression model. model original data can computed. simulation returns value far different true values, can resampled follows. resampling returns better estimates.

title: Simulations
text: Consider dependent data set generated . resample follows.
code: set.seed(1234) n <- 500  burnin <- 500 data_ts <- data.frame('Y'=rep(NA,n+burnin),                       'X'=rnorm(n+burnin)) for(i in 1:(n+burnin)){   if(i>5){     data_ts$Y[i] <- data_ts$X[i] + sum(seq(5,3,-0.5)/10*data_ts$X[i-1:5]) + rnorm(1)   }else{     data_ts$Y[i] <- data_ts$X[i] + rnorm(1)   } } data_ts <- data_ts[-(1:burnin),] res <- resample(data = data_ts,method='sliding',blockSize = 5) res1 <- resample(data_ts,method='segment',blockSize = 5)

title: Equalized permutation for statified data
text: goal purify …

text: can install development version purify GitHub :

title: Equalized permutation for statified data
text: add github actions later, regular development, add soon, use actions month days.

title: Summary
text: Purify R package designed bootstrap resampling permutation testing, aimed researchers practitioners analyze complex datasets dependent output variable multiple predictors. package enables users perform robust statistical analyses allowing permutations predictor variables keeping output variable unchanged. Purify offers four versatile resampling methods: simple, stratify, sliding, segment, can tailored specific data structures research questions. intuitive interface customizable options, Purify streamlines process hypothesis testing estimation statistical significance.

title: Summary
text: Bootstrap resampling fundamental estimating distribution statistic, testing hypotheses, deriving confidence intervals, especially analytical solutions impractical. Standard R packages often provide basic resampling methods lack specialized support complex structures, dependent independent variables flexible resampling schemes. Purify fills gap enabling data scientists researchers perform targeted, customizable resampling retaining dependencies variables, making ideal rigorous hypothesis testing model evaluation. package’s support stratified segmented sampling allows users address scenarios grouped ordered data, providing critical resource modern applied statistical research. incorporating sophisticated resampling techniques, Purify enhances robustness reliability statistical inferences drawn complex (particular unbalanced) datasets.

title: Summary
text: primary function Purify resample_function(), four available resampling methods: Simple: Standard permutation predictor variables without additional structure. Stratify: Resampling within specified strata maintain group structure. Sliding: Applying sliding window generate resamples time-ordered data. Segment: Dividing data segments resampling within . flexibility enables users adapt Purify diverse data contexts hypothesis-testing requirements. permutation functions  included complex cases. packages also includes functions analyzing resultant data boxplot_strata() stratified samples.

title: Summary
text: following example demonstrates use Purify simulated data, applying mean squared error (MSE) calculation 1,000 resamples using simple method: ```{r eval=False} library(purify)

title: Summary
text: set.seed(123) n <- 100 data <- data.frame( output = rnorm(n), predictor1 = rnorm(n), predictor2 = rnorm(n) )

what: Define a custom function to calculate MSE
title: Summary
text: mse_function <- function(data) { mean((data$output - predict(lm(output ~ ., data = data)))^2) }

title: Summary
text: results <- resample_function(data = data, fn = mse_function, M = 1000, method = ‘simple’) ``` Model coefficients can also examined permutation; see documentation. However, use case complex implemented , function  can used directly return resampled data.

title: Summary
text: Purify implemented R, using vectorized operations efficient computation. package’s modular design clear documentation make easy adapt various research needs, allowing users integrate statistical functions modify resampling parameters meet specific analytical requirements. Purify used @tetui:etal:2022 several upcoming papers.

title: Summary
text: Development Purify package inspired foundational methods statistical resampling permutation testing. Special thanks open-source R community support resources.

title: Summary
text: Contributions Purify welcome. Please submit pull requests open issues GitHub repository.

title: Resample data — resample
text: Resample data use estimation models.

title: Resample data — resample
code: resample(   data,   M = 1000,   method = c("simple", "stratify", "sliding", "segment"),   size = nrow(data),   replace = TRUE,   blockSize = 1,   strata = NULL )

title: Resample data — resample
text: data Data.frame resampled rows observations columns variables. Note, variables permuted, sure remove output variable wish model permuted data. M Numeric. Number permutation iterations. method String indicating method permutation test. Options include 'simple', 'stratify', 'sliding' 'segment'. Simple permutes entire data set random. Stratify  segments data based stratification variable, stratify, resamples group. groups sampled produce evenly sized groups size size/number groups. Sliding segment take blocks data, thereby preserving dependence. Sliding take sliding groups, thus repeating values, .e. 1-4, 2-5, 3-6, . Segment repeat values, .e. 1-4, 5-8, 9-12, . size Numeric size resampled data. Typically original data set. However, method='stratify' group extremely small, may valuable decrease size. replace Boolean. Indicates data permuted (FALSE) bootstrapped (TRUE). size large, permuting may impossible. blockSize Numeric size blocks using method sliding segment. Otherwise unused. strata String numeric. indicate column stratify data method stratify. can column number column name.

title: Resample data — resample
text: List resampled data sets.

title: Resample and apply data — resample_function
text: Resample data compute related values function. function convenient extension resample() similar function can constructed using resample() resample_function() insufficient. code permutes every column except first ('output'), applies function permuted sample (non-permuted) output.

title: Resample and apply data — resample_function
text: data Data.frame resampled rows observations columns variables. Note, variables except first permuted, first used models given fn. fn Function apply resampled data set. return data,frame first column variable estimates (row variables). ... parameters resampling. See parameters resample(), given, defaults used.

title: Resample and apply data — resample_function
text: list items. first results dataframe. following columns row per variable. estimates: Mean parameter estimates fn resampled trials. sd: Standard deviations estimates fn resampled trials. lowerNorm: Lower confidence interval assuming normality using alpha. upperNorm: Upper confidence interval assuming normality using alpha. lowerResamp: Lower confidence interval data using alpha. upperResamp: Upper confidence interval data using alpha. second entry list resampled data estimates reference. samples: list resampled data. function_values: list function output values resampled data. Note, includes used estimates. estimates: data frame first column element function_values. row means used meanParams.
